airport_name: Norman Y. Mineta San Jose International Airport

primary: Customs and Border Protection (CBP) General Aviation Fact Sheet
National Weather Service - San Francisco Bay Area
FAA Flight Deck Pilot Information publications

operational_hours.notes: Airport open 24 hours. Control tower operates 06:00-00:00 PST. Class E airspace outside tower hours.

slot_requirements.notes: No slot requirement system. However, international arrivals require US Customs pre-clearance with 24-hour advance notice.

weather_vulnerability.weather_patterns: Mediterranean climate. Summer: warm and dry (avg temps 85-95Â°F). Winter: mild with occasional rain. Fog common early mornings, especially June-August.
weather_vulnerability.fog_characteristics: Frequent morning/early afternoon fog, particularly June-August

runway_specifications.notes: Two parallel runways at 11,000 feet each. Modern concrete surface with groving for traction. Excellent approach capabilities.

special_training: Understanding of Silicon Valley airspace complexity
Familiarization with Reid-Hillview (KRHV) and Moffett (KNUQ) nearby airports (wrong airport prevention)
Transponder with altitude reporting and ADS-B required
crew_requirements.notes: Standard pilot qualifications. Emphasis on preventing wrong airport landings due to proximity to other facilities.

handling_options: Fixed Base Operators: Signature Flight Support, BBA Aviation
handling_complexity.notes: Good handling infrastructure. US Customs pre-clearance available for international arrivals (24-hour notice required). CBP inspection services 09:00-18:00.

congestion_metrics.airspace_complexity: Moderate - Class C airspace under San Francisco Class B
congestion_metrics.notes: Congestion moderate; influenced by Silicon Valley business travel patterns. Potential delays during tech conference seasons.

permits_and_clearances.notes: International arrivals require US Customs pre-clearance. Landing permit may be required based on flight type.
permits_and_clearances.international_flights: Customs landing rights available with 24-hour PPR

noise_restrictions.preferred_departure_routes: Standard SID/STAR procedures for noise management
noise_restrictions.notes: Minimal noise restrictions compared to other California airports.

infrastructure_reliability.runway_condition: Well-maintained, grooved concrete provides good traction

security_requirements.security_screening_time_avg: Standard TSA screening for commercial terminals
security_requirements.notes: General aviation area separate from commercial terminals. Standard TSA procedures for commercial passengers.

seasonal_factors.notes: Summer fog (June-August) most notable weather factor. Silicon Valley business patterns drive seasonal variation. Year-round mild weather.

backup_alternates.name: San Francisco International Airport
backup_alternates.notes: Major international hub, can experience fog-related delays

backup_alternates.name: Reid-Hillview Airport
backup_alternates.notes: General aviation nearby (potential wrong airport risk)

alternate_airport_proximity.notes: Good alternate airports available. Oakland and San Francisco both within 30 miles. Must be aware of nearby Reid-Hillview (KRHV) and Moffett (KNUQ) to prevent wrong airport approaches.

payment_and_fees.notes: Standard fee structure. Competitive FBO pricing available.

primary_challenges: Summer fog (June-August) affecting visibility and operations
Customs clearance requirement (24-hour notice) for international arrivals
Wrong airport landing risk due to proximity to Reid-Hillview and Moffett
Silicon Valley business traffic patterns creating peak-hour congestion
Closely-spaced parallel runways requiring specific procedures
operational_advantages: US Customs pre-clearance available for international flights
Strong FBO services for private operations
summary.crew_considerations: Standard pilot qualifications sufficient. Must be familiar with closely-spaced parallel runway procedures. Awareness of nearby wrong-airport landing risks (KRHV, KNUQ). For international arrivals, must contact customs 24 hours in advance.
summary.planning_recommendation: Summer fog (June-August) may cause early morning delays; plan flexible schedules. Business hours (08:00-17:00 weekdays) experience moderate congestion from Silicon Valley traffic. International arrivals require 24-hour customs notice. Consider nearby airports for diversions (OAK at 30 miles). Year-round mild weather allows predictable operations. Tech conference seasons (March-April, September) may increase congestion.
